meanings.definition: A metrical foot consisting of two short syllables followed by a long syllable.
meanings.sent1: The anapaest in the poem had two short beats and one long beat.
meanings.sent2: The poet used an anapaest to create a rhythmic pattern in the verse.
meanings.sent3: The anapaest danced lightly through the lines of the poem.
meanings.sent4: Her words moved like an anapaest, quick and then drawn out.
meanings.sent5: The anapaest added a lively bounce to the otherwise steady rhythm.

meanings.definition: A line of verse consisting of two anapaestic metrical feet.
meanings.sent1: The anapaest in the stanza flowed smoothly with its two metrical feet.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a beautiful poem with an anapaest as the central line.
meanings.sent3: The anapaest in the verse seemed to skip happily along.
meanings.sent4: His speech had the cadence of an anapaest, rising and falling.
meanings.sent5: The anapaest stood out in the poem, marking a change in pace.
